p: Diabetes mellitus (DM) is a persistent metabolic disorder associated with carbohydrate, lipid, and protein metabolisms that contribute to several kinds of complications, including diabetic cardiomyopathy [ 1]. Diabetic cardiomyopathy is one of the significant complications of diabetes mellitus. Diabetic cardiomyopathy is the most imperative basis of death in 65% of patients with diabetes [ 1].
